title.narrative: Help animals in Venezuela as result of COVID19

description.narrative: COVID-19, or Coronavirus, has accentuated an already dire situation in Venezuela, especially for abandoned, community and rescue dogs & cats. During the past month (since mid-March), Venezuela is under a mandatory quarantine, which strongly limits the possibilities of survival to millions of dogs & and cats across the country. We are providing food, emergency vet care and support to thousands of animals, but we need your help to continue extending our reach.

mailing-address.narrative: AV PRIMERA AVENIDA CON PRIMERA TRANSVERSA EDIF PEBAMBU PISO 11 APT 114 URB LOS PALOS GRANDES Caracas 1060 Venezuela

title.narrative: COVID19 relief to 4,000 migrant workers Bangalore

description.narrative: The plight of India's migrant workers in the COVID 19 lockdown was highlighted on international news channels. Overnight migrant workers found themselves unable to work and not able to return to their villages. They are effectively trapped in migrant worker camps with no money, food, work or real chances of social distancing. To prevent hunger and destitution in Bangalore's migrant communities, Sampark plans to distribute essential food and provision to 12000 migrant workers and their families

mailing-address.narrative: 39, 1st Avenue, Teachers Colony 1st Block Koramangala 1st Block, Koramangala, Bangalore 560035 Bangalore 560034 India

title.narrative: Help Feed Slum Families during this COVID 19

description.narrative: About a month ago the pandemic was first reported in Kenya. The effects of this has left most families suffering. These people relied on peasant business like: selling groceries at the evening market, some work in transport businesses having almost no income at all. Most of the people in Nyalenda work during the day to be able to purchase food for dinner. no money earned means no dinner that day. There is also lack PPE. We ask for your donations to cushion them from suffering

mailing-address.narrative: P.O BOX 3317 RINGROAD NYALENDA KISUMU, Nyanza 40100 Kenya

description.narrative: Aarogya Seva is expanding on the successful implementation of a COVID-19 Mental Health Helpline, by adding a tele-health helpline to assist community members with non-COVID related health concerns. The aim of the tele-health helpline is to provide the public with an alternative method to receive access to general healthcare and health advice.

mailing-address.narrative: 2307 S Rural Road Tempe, AZ 85282 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 FOOD DONATIONS CAMPAIGN IN NIGERIA

description.narrative: In many slums in Nigeria, millions of people who are affected by the over 2 months lockdown may not have been reached with the palliatives shared by the government for several reasons. One of them is that there is no access roads to where they live and were not captured in the Social Investment Program of the Federal Government. By this project, we wish to raise funds to enable us distribute food items, such as: rice, garri, yams, etc to 100 of such families selected from Imo State and the FCT.

mailing-address.narrative: 7/9 Mbari Street (2nd floor, flat 1) Ikenegbu Layout Owerri, Imo 460001 Nigeria

description.narrative: COVID-19 is presenting a disparate threat to Palestinians in Israel and in the Occupied Territories. Adalah has been taking emergency legal action before the Israeli Supreme Court to demand access to healthcare, and to promote dignified living conditions and civil liberties protections. The government's deliberate neglect of Palestinians over decades through gross discrimination, and its protracted military Occupation, is being amplified during this crisis with potentially disastrous outcomes.

organisation.narrative: Adalah - The Legal Center for Arab Minority Rights in Israel

mailing-address.narrative: 94 Yaffa St PO Box 8921 Haifa, Haifa 31090 Israel

title.narrative: Help us keep fighting for the Amazon!

description.narrative: Help us keep fighting for the Amazon! We're an NGO working to protect the rainforest and, just like millions of others around the world, COVID-19 has been a major disruption. The funding we rely on has been hit particularly hard, putting at risk our ability to continue to conduct research for science-based conservation, to plant trees to recover the rainforest, and to provide high-quality environmental education to our region's kids. Can we count on your support to help us keep going?

organisation.narrative: Alliance for a Sustainable Amazon Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: 7224 Boscastle Ln Hanover, MD 21076 United States

title.narrative: Support daily wagers In India affected by Covid-19

description.narrative: Covid 19, an unprecedented disaster unfolding in India and globally as well, is a call for mankind to re-think, introspect, re-set ourselves to respond to this massive crisis and beyond. The biggest impact is emerging on a very large number of daily wagers, migrant workers who are out of jobs, and are going back to their villages. A lot of them are also stuck in the cities with hardly any resources. With the loss of livelihoods, a large number of them will now struggle to support their familie

mailing-address.narrative: J- 93 Sarita Vihar New Delhi, Delhi 110076 India

title.narrative: COVID 3-D Printed Face Shields, Masks & Ear Guards

description.narrative: Aarogya Seva will be using the 3D printers they have stationed in various 3D-printing satellite centers across India to begin 3-D printing face shields, masks, ear guards and various other parts for medical equipment that is in high demand in the current COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 2307 S Rural Road Tempe, AZ 85282 United States

title.narrative: Coronavirus Covid-19 Bubi Hospital Appeal Zimbabwe

description.narrative: As Zimbabwe prepares for the peak of the virus there is significant concern from Bubi District Hospital about their ability to meet the demands about to be put on their system. They have approached us and our partner Trinity Project to help provide essential equipment to save lives and protect front line workers.

mailing-address.narrative: Oak House 94 Park Lane LEEDS, West Yorkshire LS3 1EL United Kingdom

description.narrative: Aarogya Seva in collaboration with the Government of Karnataka proposes the commissioning of two refurbished, medically equipped, 9 bed quarantine buses and an ambulance with a ventilator system for the sole transportation and in transit SOS treatment of Covid - 19 patients and suspected cases from the source location to a secure medical facility for the city of Bangalore, Karnataka.

mailing-address.narrative: 2307 S Rural Road Tempe, AZ 85282 United States

title.narrative: Help Avoid a COVID-19 Explosion Among Refugees

description.narrative: The massive number of refugees in Jordan make up one of the most vulnerable, high risk groups in the world to contract, die from, and rapidly spread the COVID-19 virus - in their population and the wider region. A deadly combination of risk factors creates an immediate and potent formula threatening to erupt into a major humanitarian catastrophe, posing a perilous threat in the world, if we do nothing. We are using tele-med to reach as many refugees with vital health care services as possible.

mailing-address.narrative: 12170 S. Pine Ayr Drive % Steve S Olweean Climax, Michigan 49034 United States

title.narrative: Help Mexican Children w/Cancer in Times of COVID19

description.narrative: COVID-19 has made resources scarcer than ever before for low-income girls, boys and young people who suffer from cancer in Mexico. With your help, we can support the 1,200 children we have in active treatment and the 4,800 children we have in present remission.

organisation.narrative: Casa de la Amistad para Ninos con Cancer

mailing-address.narrative: Aldama #2, Col. San Juan Tepepan Del. Xochimilco Mexico City, Mexico City 16020 Mexico

title.narrative: Help Rural Communities to Strive Against COVID-19

description.narrative: Considering the threat and sanitary crisis the Corona Virus poses, we resolve to engage in community outreach programmes. This is done through reaching out, mobilization, orientating and building the capacities of rural community members. There will be educational outreach trainings programmes, radio discussions, artwork, posters and leadership training interventions with emphasis on creating synergy among duty bearers of communities on fighting against the spread of COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Movement towards Education and Youth Empowerment-Sierra Leone

mailing-address.narrative: 4 Mannah Lane, Kennedy Section. Bo City 0000 Sierra Leone

title.narrative: COVID19 Relief: Holistic Healthcare in India

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic is wrecking havoc on the poor and marginalized in India. This project exponentially expands access to healthcare, builds hand sanitizing stations in rural villages and suburban slums, provides nutritional supplements for those who can no longer work because of the shut down of Indian life, provides PPE for medical personnel and expands the reach of our clinics across the country.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 3459 Virginia Beach, VA 23454 United States

title.narrative: SAVE THE WOMEN ECONOMY / SALVA LA ECONOMIA LOCAL

description.narrative: Este proyecto brindara capacitacion en linea a 125 emprendedoras de de 7 estados de Mexico. Les daremos herramientas para que transformen sus negocios a las nuevas necesidades del mercado derivado de COVID-19. / This project will provide online training to 125 female entrepreneurs from 7 states of Mexico. We will give them tools to transform their businesses to the new needs of the market derived from COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Crea Comunidades de Emprendedores Sociales, A.C.

mailing-address.narrative: Culiacan 15 Condesa Mexico, Mexico City 06100 Mexico

title.narrative: Amar Seva Sangam's efforts to fight Covid 19.

description.narrative: The spread of the Corona virus world over is causing unimaginable human losses. The halt of the spread of the virus is utmost important and a priority over every other need. This is particularly so in the case of Persons with Disabilities, who are very vulnerable due to poor immunity. Added to this, the precautionary measures introduced by the governments, though absolutely necessary, have put the PwDs into more hardships.

mailing-address.narrative: Sulochana Gardens, 7-4-104B, Tenkasi Road Ayikudy, Tamil Nadu 627852 India

title.narrative: Emergency Aid in the Covid pandemic- South Asia

description.narrative: In the world, 129.2 million girls are out of school.In Southern Asia, girls are disadvantaged for almost all levels of education.The Coronavirus pandemic is likely to have a huge impact on them, with an increased risk of sexual exploitation, early pregnancy and forced marriage.The economic hardships caused by the crisis will likely induce some families to invest less in girls' education beside increasing their domestic and caring responsibilities. The project take place in India and Bangladesh

mailing-address.narrative: Via Ronchi, 17 --- Milano 20134 Italy

title.narrative: Food for workers starving in Pakistan due to COVID

description.narrative: COVID-19 has left daily wage workers starving. With no income whatsoever, they have no ability to feed families & are entirely dependent on food referred to locally as "rations" simply not to starve to death. Government-organized food rations are sadly being looted. DGF - Educate a Girl has key members on the ground working for this cause, despite the dangers, and this project fundraises for Heritage Foundation, The Garage School, SmileSunshine & HunarmaadKarachi.

organisation.narrative: Dawood Global Foundation - Educate a Girl

mailing-address.narrative: G3, Ground Floor, BRR Tower Hassan Ali Street, off I I Chundrigar Road Karachi, Sindh 74000 Pakistan

title.narrative: Periods Don't Stop for COVID19 Pandemic Help Girls

description.narrative: The consequences of the COVID-19 outbreak are felt most acutely by the marginalized, particularly women and girls. Due to lack of money and gender perspective hardly any government money goes toward adolescent girls. The lack of proper menstrual health management may lead to greater risks of infections. The limited food intake now would also aggravate the health of already malnourished girls. We are planning to provide sanitary pads and supplementary nutrition for 1000 poor adolescent girls.

organisation.narrative: Center for Women's Development and Research

mailing-address.narrative: 23. Jayaram Street, Vasanth Apartments 'D' 1st floor, Kuppam Beach Road, Thiruvnamiyur Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041 India

title.narrative: BE THERE - support young people during coronavirus

description.narrative: When the world is told to distance yourselves and remain isolated, young people living in challenging circumstances feel heightened levels of anxiety and loneliness. The coronavirus crisis is making life tough for young people, so now is a critical time for us to support our students. We plan to offer online music-making and social sessions for EVERY young person. That's 350 students and 475 sessions every week! Please will you "BE THERE" to help us support young people when they need us most?

mailing-address.narrative: 58 Kimber Rd Wandsworth London, London SW18 4PP United Kingdom

title.narrative: Help Haiti's first line response to Covid-19

description.narrative: The head of the Covid-19 effort in Haiti is hoping for availability of 3,000 hospital beds. There are actually only 70 beds currently available, of these 40 are provided by St Luke's Hospital. We are gearing up to provide additional beds, we have separate staff for the COVID-19 patients, and we are desperately looking to be ready with equipment (mostly PPE) for our employees. Community support remains a central focus of St Luke's programs: we distribute chlorox for handwashing, masks and food

organisation.narrative: Fondazione Francesca Rava Nph Italia Onlus

mailing-address.narrative: Viale Premuda 38/A Milano, Italy 20129 Italy

title.narrative: Supporting Daphe to come out of an abusive home.

description.narrative: Daphe a sixteen year old girl living in Uganda, she was defiled and gave birth to a baby boy now 4 month. since then she has been subjected to repeated physical and psychological torture by her father. Due to COVID-19 pandemic stress at home, the father has chased Daphe and the baby away from the only place she calls home. we want to support daphe to have shelter, food, clothes and seed capital to start her own business and leave a free and dignified life with her baby.

mailing-address.narrative: Galt road kabale road Mbarara Municipality, Mbarara 256 Uganda

description.narrative: Waste collectors are critical in a circular economy, yet are among the most marginalized people. Many are women and children living at the fringes of society, unable to access health care and education. Yet they play a vital role in their communities by removing waste and keeping materials out of the environment. They aren't equipped to be on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. We ask for your help to support their immediate needs while advancing better future conditions.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Thomas Circle NW Suite 800 Washington, D.C. 20005 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19: WE TAKE CARE OF CASE RONALD'S FAMILIES!

description.narrative: Italy is one of the most affected countries by COVID-19, with more than 228.000 cases. In these times of great emergency, Fondazione per l'Infanzia Ronald McDonald Italia wants to give its support, by continuing to help and to take care of the community and, in particular, of all families who have to travel far from home and spend several weeks or months to get treatment for their seriously ill or injured children.

organisation.narrative: Fondazione per l'Infanzia Ronald McDonald Italia

mailing-address.narrative: Centro direzionale Milano Fiori Nord - Edificio U7 Via del Bosco Rinnovato, 6 Assago, Lombardia 20090 Italy

description.narrative: - Sanitation and toiletries need for enhanced safety and prevention. - Ration and packed food items with a durable shelf life towardshealth,nutrition andsurvival. -Medical support and first aid provisioning towards screening andpreventionof thespreadof COVID19 -Emergencyprotocol Support - Mobility and social Isolation programs. -Rehabilitation support - food security, financial security, emotional and mental well-being for the children at the homes and safety for communities andunder

organisation.narrative: Association for Rural and Urban Needy

mailing-address.narrative: 1-1-711/C/1, Gandhinagar Opposite Vishnu Residency Hyderabad, Telangana 500080 India

title.narrative: Support Healthy Smiles for Children in Ecuador

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has unfortunately limited Global Smile Foundation's ability to conduct our scheduled missions in Guayaquil, Ecuador. We continue to provide much-needed care for our patients and their families via Telehealth & also provide them with infant formula, specialized bottles, medications & other necessary supplies.

mailing-address.narrative: 101 Access Road, Suite 205 Norwood, MA 02062 United States

description.narrative: Heroes for All has been involved helping the struggling population of daily wage earners and unemployed providing 1 wk supply of food items since March 18. 1 bag cost $5.81 The volunteers and members of the organization is going door to door handing over the food so that the people who are in crisis do not need to come out of their homes. We successfully managed to support +3000 families across Bangladesh with whatever fund we managed to raise and continuing the distribution in remote villages.

mailing-address.narrative: 160 Evergreen Rd Brockport, NY 14420 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 RESPONSE OF RESOURCE LESS IN POOR COUNTRY

description.narrative: PROJECT SUMMARY Currently as the whole world is focusing on the combating of world pandemic through any possible methods to save lives. Ethiopian is also on the way of struggling to scape from the world pandemic COVID-19 as cases are increasing day to day and deaths are already recorded. HIYAW FIKIR YELIJOCH ENA YEWETATOCH LIMAT MAHIBER working with more than 170 children and with their parents. Our beneficiaries are parts of the community who are poorest of poor people even don't have to eat.

organisation.narrative: HIYAW FIKIR YELIJOCH ENA YEWETATOCH LIMAT MAHIBER

mailing-address.narrative: Franko road Goro Kebele Adama 774 Ethiopia

description.narrative: Our world faces an unprecedented challenge in the face of COVID-19. As a global community, we share your focus on individual safety and the health of our world. Atlas Corps is also focused on the safety and welfare of our Fellows. We currently have 70 Fellows in active service in the USA. They continue to serve from virtual offices. Atlas Corps continues to support them. We also maintain our focus on developing leaders, strengthening organizations. Today, we ask you for a small gift of support.

mailing-address.narrative: 99 M Street SE 4th Floor Washington, DC 20003 United States

title.narrative: Covid-19 Salary Support for Child Caregivers

description.narrative: Raising the funds to compensate for the added salary costs over the next 3 months is proving challenging, but we can ensure that our hardworking team can be timeously remunerated. COVID-19 has had huge economic impacts on so many around the world. We know that we are entering (and South Africa is already in) a severe financial recession, but we also know together we can curb the impact on the quality childcare we provide as much as possible by supporting the team that keeps our home going.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 136 Bronkhorstfontein Johannesburg, Gauteng 1872 South Africa

title.narrative: Provide baby formula to 500 families in Thailand

description.narrative: Ubon Ratchathani is home to many Thai migrant workers who have lost their jobs and returned home from Bangkok due to do the COVID-19 pandemic. We have an already-existing infant formula program in partnership with the Thai government's Department of Social Development & Welfare. We will be delivering food and infant formula with the Thai government to families who have been identified as most in need. We hope to bridge the gap for families until they can go back to work when the economy reopens.

mailing-address.narrative: 397/2 Moo 7 T. Mae Hia Muang, Chiang Mai 50100 Thailand

title.narrative: Provide medical supplies to Honduran Hospital

description.narrative: The Hospital Escuela is the largest government run hosptial in Central America. On the best of days they do not have the supplies they need to take care of patients. Parents have to bring in wound supplies, food, and necesissities. They are not allowed to stay with their children at night. It is a teaching hospital and many of the physcians work tirelessly, often giving up their own practice for part of the day. They need supplies. Gloves, masks, protective equipment, disinfectant during COVID.

mailing-address.narrative: 3910 Suwanee Bend Dr. Suwanee, GA 30024 United States

description.narrative: The Alvaro Wille Trejos Community Empowerment and Studies Center (CEEC-AWT), our station in the Osa Peninsula, functions as a center of opportunities for local organizations in Costa Rica. Since the worldwide emergency of COVID 19, the income from tourism activity has suffered a huge drop, which has left all who depend on this activity in the zone in an economically difficult situation, as they no longer receive almost 100% of the income they expected for this year.

mailing-address.narrative: Frente al Colegio de Ingenieros y Arquitectos en Curridabat, San Jose, Costa Rica 236-1002 Paseo de los Estudiantes Curridabat, San Jose 236-1002 SJ, CR Costa Rica

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency Response in Palestine & Lebanon

description.narrative: Poverty, displacement, occupation, and siege magnify the impact of the coronavirus a thousand times. We are responding to requests from community organizations to help protect children and families in Palestine and refugees in Lebanon by providing medical aid, personal hygiene and cleaning kits, food parcels, and more.

mailing-address.narrative: 1101 8th Street #100 Berkeley, CA 94710 United States

description.narrative: Waste pickers' livelihoods consist of combing landfills and neighborhoods to collect pieces of plastic trash. Individually, these items are almost worthless, but if enough are bundled together, they may be sold for recycling. These communities provide a vital service but are compromised by their living conditions and marginalized by their lack of status. They are being severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic and need urgent support to deal with its consequences.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 1829 Dillon, CO 80435 United States

description.narrative: While responsible for delivering the majority of the world's materials to the recycling value chain, informal collectors are also critical to maintaining public health and sanitation. They are often marginalized in their own communities and have limited access to basic needs such as food, education, and healthcare. In Ghana, the COVID-19 pandemic is deeply affecting the lives and livelihoods of the waste collector community and they need immediate support to cope with the crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: 99 M St SE Suite 400 Washington, DC, DC 20003 United States

description.narrative: This project will support Cambodian Children's Fund's effort to protect the vulnerable community of Steung Meanchey from COVID-19 by providing hygiene and sanitation products and resources to students and families to ensure they are educated and updated regarding COVID-19, they remain safe and healthy, and to prevent the spread of the virus across vulnerable populations in Cambodia.

mailing-address.narrative: 2309 Santa Monica Blvd., #833 Santa Monica, CA 90404 United States

description.narrative: Cepal (Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean) estimates a contraction in Latin America of 5.3% in 2020, due to Covid-19. In June 2020, Ecuador revealed that 180,852 employment contracts were finished during the health emergency. This economic contraction will generate almost 11.5 million new unemployed and almost 30 million more poor people. Formal employment has been lost, for this reason economic reactivation is imperative in the target group "Entrepreneurial Single Mothers"

organisation.narrative: Israel Foundation - CDC Community Development Center

mailing-address.narrative: Av Victor Emilio Estrada 822 e Higueras Urdesa Central Guayaquil, Guayas Ecuador

title.narrative: Mindful Action: COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund

description.narrative: In response to the unbearable levels of suffering among the poorest and most marginalized communities in South and Southeast Asia, INEB has set up a COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund. Our goal is to be able to increase our response to the most urgent needs for food supplies, hygiene and sanitary supplies, in addition to medicine, hospital beds, and toilets. We know this is a difficult time to ask for your support, but this is the moment when even a small contribution can save lives.

mailing-address.narrative: 666 Charoen Nakhon Road, Banglamphu Lang, Khlong San Bangkok, Bangkok 10600 Thailand

title.narrative: Feed the Hunger and Relief during COVID-19 crisis

description.narrative: This project will feed the hunger and sanitation support for the small farmers, agricultural daily wages labourers, and informal sector workers whose are affected by COVID-19 crisis in India. In India 93% of workers whose are lost their income and do not get a regularly monthly pay.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot No. 25, Narmadha Nadhi, 4th Street,Mahatma Gandhi Nagar, Madurai Madurai, Tamil Nadu 625014 India

title.narrative: EMERGENCY RESPONSE TO COVID-19 IN BULOBURTE DIST

description.narrative: COVID-19 EMERGENCY RESPONSE ACTIVITIES OF BUDO NGO Training of local health care workers on how to recognize and manage COVID 19 - BUDO will train local health-care workers in order to recognize, & manage or treat the COVID-19 suspected & infected patients. - BUDO health workers will create awareness on COVID-19 through megaphone & make the community alert that this disease is a worldwide disaster. - BUDO health workers will enhance community awareness raising on the social distancing,

mailing-address.narrative: GN 209 Taleh Street Hodan District Mogadishu n/a Somalia

title.narrative: Pandemic Aid for Families in Rwanda

description.narrative: Although the COVID lockdown has ended in Rwanda, our families are still struggling with issues related to the pandemic. Schools have significantly increased fees to cover sanitation, masks and physical changes to accommodate social distancing. In addition, our Executive Director has been unable to travel to Rwanda to bring in fabric for the Umva dyeing efforts. Without the ability to dye the Umva textiles for us to sell on their behalf, the dyers have lost their monthly income.

mailing-address.narrative: 116 Paine Rd Westmoreland, NH 03467 United States

description.narrative: The COVID-19 crisis has been affecting everyone's way of living, but it is especially difficult for people who are already vulnerable. Association for Aid and Relief, Japan (AAR Japan) is supporting persons with disabilities (PWDs) in Japan by providing hygiene items such face masks and other sanitary items to protect themselves.

organisation.narrative: Association for Aid and Relief, Japan (AAR Japan)

mailing-address.narrative: 7F, Mizuho Building 2-12-2 Kamiosaki Shinagawa-ku, Tokyo 1410024 Japan

title.narrative: COVID19: Food relief for vulnerable Australians

description.narrative: COVID-19, and the resulting mass unemployment being experienced across the country has been the catalyst in the exponential increase in food insecurity. Foodbank is in urgent need of funding to source key staple foods that don't come in sufficient quantities via traditional rescue channels. This will enable Foodbank to provide a sustainable supply in a variety of essential foods that are nutritious and convenient for vulnerable Australians during these extraordinary and unprecedented times.

mailing-address.narrative: 11 Julius Ave North Ryde, NSW 2113 Australia

title.narrative: COVID-19 Elderly and Disabled Veteran Supplies

description.narrative: We have been feeding the elderly and disabled veterans of North Carolina since March 3rd, 2020. We have fed 256 veterans and first responders in-need by purchasing meals over 3-4 weeks. The word has gotten out about our efforts and our phones are ringing nonstop with requests. Our goal is to take care of as many families as we can for the duration of the virus and stay-at-home protocol. We have partnered with Carolina Farm Trust, a nonprofit, on this mission as well and want to raise funds.

organisation.narrative: US Military Veterans Hall of Fame

mailing-address.narrative: 4522 Carnfeld LN Charlotte, NC 28215 United States

title.narrative: Relief, Wellbeing and Empowerment During Pandemic

description.narrative: Covid - 19 Pandemic, a Global health crisis is affecting people's health, the economy and the society. Your contributions will help conduct awareness programs through community outreach programs. Address mental health challenges, enable optimum potential of the human systems, fortify immunity and exponentially increase the ability of critically ill patients to recover from the condition through Aashwasan services.

mailing-address.narrative: 405, 3 A Cross HRBR Layout 2nd Block Kammanahalli Bangalore, Karnataka 560043 India

title.narrative: Fight the spread of COVID-19 in Rural Haiti

description.narrative: The number of people infected with the COVID-19 virus in Haiti continues to grow. Our rural partners cannot stay sheltered in place as their livelihood depends entirely on them being out in the fields working. We are taking measures to provide members of 60 organizations (over 3,000 families) with the education needed on the pandemic and the necessary equipment to protect themselves, their families and communities.

mailing-address.narrative: 1050 Connecticut Ave NW Suite 500 Washington, DC 20036 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response for First Mile waste collectors

description.narrative: Global response efforts are underway for COVID-19 but the poor are disproportionately left behind. The First Mile, an initiative of WORK and Thread, supports waste collectors in Haiti, Honduras, and Taiwan. This network of thousands of women and men working hard to clean up the environment to make ends meet mostly lack an identity and access to safety net services. Your donation supports our comprehensive response of prevention, treatment, and access to medical care, and long-term support.

mailing-address.narrative: 7800 Susquehanna Street Suite 502 Pittsburgh, PA 15208 United States

title.narrative: Supporting Waste Pickers through the COVID crisis

description.narrative: In many parts of SE Asia and Latin America, informal waste collectors are the backbone of the waste management system, salvaging materials and keeping them out of the ocean and environment. Now they are also on the frontline of the COVID19 crisis - vulnerable and exposed. The Circulate Initiative is working with partners in Indonesia, Vietnam, and Argentina to get food, protective gear, and hygiene kits to these communities now, and to help them build a better future post-crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: C/O RPCK Rastegar Panchal 60 E 42nd St, Ste 2410 New York, NY 10016 United States

description.narrative: This pandemic has shown us that education is vital as many children today cannot go to school. As many of you know, we had to suspend classes at our daycare and preschool to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and families. Thankfully, our program has continued through distance learning. But, parents have had to dedicate their time to educating their children instead of working. Because of this, our families are in desperate need of additional support during this quarantine.

mailing-address.narrative: Enrique Velasco Ibarra 9 Colonia Santa Julia San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato 37750 Mexico

title.narrative: Emergency Response to COVID-19 in Moya Communities

description.narrative: A GG micro-grant has helped Moya Centre initiate a Covid-19 emergency response plan. Now we must scale it up. We have a responsibility as a community-based org. to support those who are in desperate need of assistance during this unprecedented time. With a national lock down in place to flatten the curve, many guardians of Moya children are out of work. Moya has switched gears to provide immediate relief in the form of food and hygiene parcels, as well as education, for families most in need.

organisation.narrative: Moya Trust (also known as Moya Centre)

mailing-address.narrative: Corner Plot of Malandela's Farm Mahlanya H124 Eswatini

title.narrative: Holistic support for slum dwellers during Covid-19

description.narrative: In addition to our regular activities of providing dry ration, basic medicines and sanitation kit to the slum dwellers, we are also concentrating on rapid antigen testing and vaccinating them from various private hospitals so that they can acquire the required immunity to fight against the virus. We are also providing data recharge to the students, running awareness sessions about the need to wear masks, wash hands and get vaccinated as well as taking care of their mental health.

mailing-address.narrative: 85 Collin Street, 4th Floor Kolkata, West Bengal 700016 India

title.narrative: COVID - 19 Home Literacy Project for 1,500 Girls

description.narrative: Achievers Ghana Education is seeking support for its COVID-19 Home Literacy Project with the objective of helping to serve the community with education in local languages to ensure residents of Nima and Mamobi are well informed on COVID-19 prevention measures. We will also be offering literacy help to youth. With the disruption of all activities including the closure of schools, it is imperative our students and pupils are engaged while at home with innovative ways of bridging their knowledge.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Link Off Kanda Highway Maamobi Kawukudi Accra, Greater Accra 233 Ghana

description.narrative: Deep concern over a potential rapid spread of coronavirus in Yemen. "The factors are all here. Low levels of general immunity, high levels of acute vulnerability & a fragile, overwhelmed health system," said Ms. Lise Grande, the HC in Yemen. The basic materials and aids are not available due to this civil war. SYS presents this program to combat the spread of infectious diseases and provide some means of prevention in many neighborhoods, mosques, restaurants, as well as the markets.

organisation.narrative: Support Yemeni Society Organization for Development SYS

mailing-address.narrative: Hadda St. Next to Maktabaty, P O Box 17115 Sana'a 967 Yemen

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response: Help Afghan Girls and Families

description.narrative: Sahar currently serves 25,000 girls in Afghanistan yearly. During the pandemic we are launching a COVID 19 response campaign that needs your support so that we can provide timely assistance to a population that does not have adequate access to healthcare. Our Afghan team will provide health education about the virus including hygiene and social distancing within the cultural and family structures. We will also purchase PPEs and soap from female entrepreneurs and distribute them to those in need.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 17672 Seattle, WA 98127 United States

title.narrative: Transformative Bootcamp for 200 Youth in LATAM

description.narrative: Pandemic and corruption won't steal our future! The Bootcamp will train 200 young people facing unsafe conditions in Latin America. These people will learn social entrepreneurship and innovation tools to come up with innovative ideas to improve their current situation and create a multiplier effect in their communities. According to the International Labor Organization, in 2019 the region ended with 19.8% youth unemployment rate, and COVID-19 will increase this rate at least 4 points.

organisation.narrative: Corporacion para el Desarrollo de Emprendimiento y la Innovacion Social

mailing-address.narrative: Jose Correa E11-83 Av. 6 de Diciembre Quito, Pichincha 170405 Ecuador

title.narrative: Emergency Seed Bank to avert famine in Haiti.

description.narrative: Poor rural families and farmers risk serious threat to their food and nutrition security that could escalate into famine in the aftermath of COVID-19. Undernourishment and a significant drop in agricultural production rates will result if an aggressive recovery plan is not implemented to avoid sending struggling farmers even deeper into poverty traps and malnutrition. The Seed Bank uses an inter-generational approach to strengthen community and serve as a model for social and behavioral changes.

mailing-address.narrative: 637 Monroe Street Newport, KY 41071 United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Rural Relief Distribution in India

description.narrative: Our project is distributing staple foods (rice, pulses, mustard oil, wheat flour, potatoes, salt, sugar and soap) to migrant workers and daily wage laborers in rural India where there is limited access to essential goods during the COVID-19 lockdown.

mailing-address.narrative: Hyderabad, India Hyderabad, Telangana India

description.narrative: COVID-19 is making the plight of those facing hunger much more difficult. The Global FoodBanking Network (GFN) and its food banking organizations are on the front lines in over 40 countries outside of the U.S. working tirelessly to serve those seeking hunger relief services now more than ever. GFN food banks remain rooted in communities during this crisis. We need your support to continue to build and support strong food banks that serve millions of people. Learn more at www.foodbanking.org

mailing-address.narrative: 70 E LAKE ST STE 1200 CHICAGO, IL 60601-5915 United States

description.narrative: While responsible for delivering the majority of the world's materials to the recycling value chain, informal collectors are also critical to maintaining public health and sanitation. They are often marginalized in their own communities and have limited access to basic needs such as food, decent shelter, and healthcare. In Nigeria, the COVID-19 pandemic is deeply affecting the lives and livelihoods of the waste collector community and they need immediate support to cope with the crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: 99 M St SE Suite 400 Washington, DC, DC 20003 United States

description.narrative: Freedom from Fear will increase SSI's response to the spike in violence and child abuse in Botswana, Africa. The national lockdown increased stress on families and decreased access to services leading to poverty, hunger, depression & violence in the home with little to no reprieve for victims. SSI provides counselling support, food and medication delivery, homework packets, safe shelter placements for fleeing survivors and community education on Covid-19 preventative measures.

mailing-address.narrative: 693 17th Ave Salt Lake Cty, UT 84103 United States

title.narrative: Coronavirus Response at the Floating Villages

description.narrative: Support The Lake Clinic's efforts in continuing to provide free health care across eight floating villages on the Tonle Sap Lake during the ongoing Coronavirus Pandemic. TLC is working to prevent the spread of Coronavirus to and in these villages by teaching about handwashing and preventative measures and monitoring symptoms and tracking any cases that emerge. This project will ensure TLC's long term presence in the villages throughout COVID-19 and beyond.

mailing-address.narrative: Paradise Road, Group 6, Salakanseng Village Svaydangkom Siem Reap 17252 Cambodia

description.narrative: 275 families participating in the DEHVI Foundation programs are being directly affected by the crisis we are experiencing right now due to COVID-19, causing them to fall into a situation of poverty even deeper than the one they were in before. Due to health restrictions many families have stopped receiving income, especially those who have an informal job or are in refuge status. With these donations, we will be able to support basic needs during the pandemia.

mailing-address.narrative: 8th Avenue Between 21 and 27Ath street, next to Conarroz San Jose, San Jose PO Box 3353-1000 Costa Rica

title.narrative: Help the World's Poorest Affected by COVID-19

description.narrative: For communities already in crisis - where health systems are weak, lacking basic equipment, and suffering severe shortages of healthcare workers - the impact of COVID-19 will be devastating. Concern is responding in 23 of the world's poorest countries, focusing on containment and prevention, mitigation of impact on food and income security, and early recovery for those affected. We need your support to provide essential supplies, public health information, and skills training.

mailing-address.narrative: 355 Lexington Avenue 16th Floor New York, NY 10017 United States

description.narrative: While responsible for delivering the majority of the world's materials to the recycling value chain, informal collectors are also critical to maintaining public health and sanitation. They are often marginalized in their own communities and have limited access to basic needs such as food, education, hygiene, and safety. In Rural Rajasthan, India the COVID-19 pandemic is deeply affecting the lives and livelihoods of the waste collector community.

mailing-address.narrative: 99 M St SE Suite 400 Washington, DC, DC 20003 United States

title.narrative: Support to Covid 19 Helpless People in Nepal

description.narrative: We are from Nepal, Nepal is Asia 's poorest country, We are in need We need your support so we can save the lives in Nepal, Due to the nationwide lock down for a month long, families' dependent on waged labors deprived from the opportunity of work, daily income. Finally, many people in very worst condition, they unable to daily meal and proper health care, This project will help the reach the food and health and safety to one thousand families. Please consider our request for donation.

mailing-address.narrative: Janakpur, Dhanusha, Province No 2, Nepal Janakpur +977 Nepal

title.narrative: Creating awareness about COVID 19 in Arua District

description.narrative: COVID19 pandemic in Uganda 685 cases with24 in Arua- West Nile. State of panic is a threat to community transmission. Government announced extreme lock-down measures which include; ban on public gatherings, transport and stay home to prevent the community transmission. community awareness about virus transmission, signs and symptoms, preventive measures such as social distancing, hand washing with soap, disinfecting hands, surfaces, etc, are unknown in rural poor areas with limited networks.

mailing-address.narrative: Packwach road Box 534 Arua Kampala, North Western Uganda 256 Uganda

title.narrative: Prevent domestic violence Pakistan during COVID-19

description.narrative: Spousal abuse and domestic violence is skyrocketing in Pakistan due to COVID-19 lockdowns, lost jobs, meltdown in economy and husbands working from home. This project fundraises to help abused women get help and sanctuary.

organisation.narrative: Dawood Global Foundation - Educate a Girl

mailing-address.narrative: G3, Ground Floor, BRR Tower Hassan Ali Street, off I I Chundrigar Road Karachi, Sindh 74000 Pakistan

title.narrative: Coronavirus relief for families in southern Nepal

description.narrative: Province 2 in Nepal (where we work to assist street children) has been incredibly affected by the new COVID-19 wave and the strict lockdowns. Main source of income for people has been work at factories, fields and other temporary work - all of it had to stop. There is a huge amount of people from the Dalit community (untouchables) and they rely on their daily income. People with no citizenship or other paperwork cannot claim support from the government and have no access to food.

mailing-address.narrative: 1 Pelham Street Brighton, Sussex BN1 4NA United Kingdom

title.narrative: GREEK Homeless Protection & Support during COVID19

description.narrative: In 2020, the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, affected the most vulnerable of our fellow humans deprived of a permanent roof, living in precarious conditions, exposed and marginalized. Emfasis Foundation has so far provided: - 1000's of basic necessities with contactless deliveries, psychosocial services via the operation of the 2 mobile support units & streetwork/outreach teams, a hotline number for immediate support and recording of emergency lockdown needs and vital information leaflets.

mailing-address.narrative: Mesologgiou 52 Dafni, Attiki 17234 Greece

title.narrative: LGBTQ+ care and support in the Eastern Caribbean

description.narrative: In countries where same-sex intimacy is a crime, LGBTQ+ people are often last to receive support locally. Your donation will ensure food and mobile communications for vulnerable LGBTQ+ people. Many are unable to earn a living in tourism or the informal sector as COVID-19 decimates the economies of the eastern Caribbean islands. You can help ECADE and its network uphold the dignity and independence of LGBTQ+ people in the EC facing an often intolerant community.

organisation.narrative: EASTERN CARIBBEAN ALLIANCE FOR DIVERSITY AND EQUALITY (ECADE)

mailing-address.narrative: CONCH SHELL DRIVE GROS ISLET 00124 Saint Lucia

description.narrative: Many of our community members have been disproportionately impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, experiencing sudden loss of income. They are now at risk of becoming homeless, an outcome that we strive to combat. To that end, we seek to create "Roots Rapid Relief Fund," a flexible funding source to help alleviate some of the financial hardships, provide food, ensure that they do not default on rent, utility or phone bills, and that they remain housed during this devastating pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: 9925 International Blvd. #5 Oakland, CA 94603 United States

title.narrative: Covid-19 affects CM/feed babies & homeless teens

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has affected Centre Marembo (CM) and raised many problems mostly food insecurity and WASH related issues for homeless teen mothers and babies. Due to the lockdown we are experiencing, all our agriculture and livestock activities are no longer productive. This has affected our nutrition mechanism and we are aiming to reach out to 200 homeless teen mothers, their babies, pregnant teens and street girls.

mailing-address.narrative: Ndera Sector Kigali 5255 Rwanda

title.narrative: Give Hope & Resilience To Youth In Kenya

description.narrative: Due to the prevailing pandemic, our youth centre remains closed, however, It is important we ensure the youth are not idle and remain positively engaged during these times of uncertainty brought by Covid-19. We have taken up remote learning doing zoom classes every day of the week. Our youth, who largely come from less privileged backgrounds are at risk and from engaging them other challenges have arisen hence we are now offering psychosocial support and food packages beyond remote learning.

mailing-address.narrative: Ngumo, Highview Phase 2 House no 3 Off Kemri Road Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Support 49 children w/ autism, Mex covid-19 crisis

description.narrative: Centro de Atencion para el Autism Alex IAP provides the integration of children with autism, encourages diagnosis and timely intervention through different therapies to apply inclusion at home, school and community. Educates parents on how to apply these strategies at home and create a suitable environment for the child. Provides conferences in schools and in the community, to raises awareness among the general population favoring the inclusion and independence of children with the autism.

organisation.narrative: Centro de Atencion para el Autismo Alex IAP

mailing-address.narrative: Lago Mitla 156 Lomas de Oriente 61509 Mexico

title.narrative: DSCG Community Free Range Poultry Project

description.narrative: The community of Kodike majorly depends on farming and rearing birds and animals and majorly chicken and Goat's. The community of Kodike is currently facing the challenge of of scarcity of food and limited sources of income and largely contributed by the lockdown due to Corona Virus (COVID-19). However, through David Saint Care Group (DSCG) over 25 households have been helped to have a bunch of 6 birds each, i.e. 5 female hens (layers) and 1 roaster in a bid to help boost their income.

mailing-address.narrative: Kodike Village, Nyero Sub-County, Kumi District. P.o Box 11631, Kampala. Kampala 256 Uganda

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response Project in Rural Nigeria

description.narrative: Epidemic preparedness and readiness is essential for every health facility and its personnel. This is a 12 weeks project designed to train community health workers on infection prevention and control in order to curb imminent community spread of COVID-19 in rural areas in Gombe state. The health workers will also be trained on how to locally make hand rubs for their facility consumption. In addition, we will support 114 PHC facilities with local hand washing stands to encourage hand hygiene.

title.narrative: Support for children of sex workers in COVID 19

description.narrative: The COVID 19 pandemic marks an unprecedented time in modern time that requires the best of humanity to overcome the crisis situation. The lock-down has drastically affected on the lives and livelihood of all categories of people in the society. Andhra Pradesh is one of the top ten states drastically affected by virus including rampant day by day increased cases and death toll. In the state of Andhra Pradesh there are nearly 60, 000 sex workers and 1,500 rescued victims from sex trafficking

title.narrative: Support Learning and Livelihoods during COVID-19

description.narrative: Join us as we unite to tackle the impact of COVID-19 in Kenya. We are raising funds to support families' continued learning and livelihoods. For only 2,500ksh ($25) you can help 75 households gain holistic support. Parents get help to adapt and grow their businesses. Children get engaging and fun learning activities. All of this will be delivered via a text message chatbot, at no cost to families. Help children continue learning and parents grow their businesses.

mailing-address.narrative: 92 Morningside Avenue #7E #7 New York, NY 10027 United States

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic and subsequent lockdown have created havoc in the lives of poor families, jobs lost, businesses shut down, fighting hunger, disease, their children are on the verge of discontinuing education. As this situation warrants an urgent response, we plan to provide the affected families with food, Medicine , hygiene kits, support them to revive their businesses, motivate them to find jobs, support their children's education and equip them with skills for livelihood.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for Initiatives in Development and Education for All ( IDEA)

title.narrative: Survival gardens for Zim's COVID-19 fight

description.narrative: In view of the prevailing global health crisis owing to the devastating impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, Zimconserve is initiating a project it has termed "Survival gardens" .The novel idea revolves upon the promotion of vegetable growing boxes and mandala gardens as a healthy way to counter the social distancing inhibitors that are in place to contain the escalation of the pandemic, while at the same combating malnutrition of citizens under lock-down.

title.narrative: Support Local Tech to Slow the Spread of COVID-19

description.narrative: As with many other countries, Tanzania too has been impacted by COVID-19. Twende Social Innovation Centre wants to flatten the curve by making technologies to slow the spread of the virus. According to health practitioners, handwashing destroys the virus. We have successfully tested foot-powered tippy taps, where users can wash hands without touching the tap. We need your support to bring our locally designed and built tippy taps to public hospitals, orphanages, and marketplaces in Arusha, TZ.

title.narrative: Emergency Fund for Shipibo Healers & Local Workers

description.narrative: The Chaikuni Institute is raising funds to support the Shipibo healers and local workers of three highly respected Amazonian healing centers; our sister organization, the Temple of the Way of Light, and their close friends and allies at two Shipibo, family-owned and run centers, Niwe Rao Xobo, and Shipibo Rao. 100% of the funds from this campaign will go to the Shipibo healers and local workers in the Amazon who urgently need help to cover food and living expenses during the COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Sargento Lores 841 Iquitos, Loreto 16000 Peru

description.narrative: While the whole world is looking for ways to combat COVID-19, women and girls in Sierra Leone are at particular risk. A 12-month State of Public Emergency, lockdowns, curfews and other restrictions, are a cause for great concern for the women and girls we work with. In this crisis, our provision of legal and welfare support is more vital than ever-a health crisis should not obstruct human rights. AdvocAid is working hard to ensure continuous support to women and girls in contact with the law.

mailing-address.narrative: 145 Circular Road Freetown, Western Region None Sierra Leone

description.narrative: In Una mano para Oaxaca, we are implementing a long-term post- COVID-19 crisis program that allows our indigenous communities in Oaxaca to recover from the economic recession and to regain foothold in the community.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Dont Stop Us. Look To Homeless People

description.narrative: The COVID19 has hit everyone's health and economy and those living on the street have resented it even more. We have all been sent home, but what happens when your home is the street? Today more than ever we need your help to advance the work we do with youth and families who work on the street or live in public spaces. Your donation will be used to cover the payment of the personnel that attends directly to the people and to offer our services to each family and youth.

Currently this sector concentrates 70% of food production for the country. The beneficiaries of the project are characterized by belonging to family farming, they depend on the predominant use the labor

Amid COVID-19, women are facing increased violence, restricted access to reproductive healthcare and rights, and a heightened care-giving burden. Through our partnership with CHIME FOR CHANGE this year, Global Fund for Women will focus support on women's funds in four different countries working to advance gender justice including by addressing these challenges.

description.narrative: There are many children who are deprived of basic social amenities including access to education as a result of their disability. In Ghana deaf and blind children are mostly isolated and looked down upon. The covid-19 situation has worsened their already existing situation and many of such kids are calling in for support. Its very difficult to ignore the plight of such vulnerable children when they ask for food and educational material support. In all the Project hopes to reach 1500 kids.

This project will increase community awareness on the prevention and spread of the COVID-19 disease, reduce panicking and disinformation caused by the spread of the COVID-19 disease, and ensuring the supply of basic resources such as face masks, food, and shelter to the poorest and the needy.

We will partner with 213 community-based organizations and 25 media houses to ensure the messages and spread far and wide, and to ensure direct aid (food, water, hygiene supplies) reach the most vulnerable Liberians.

title.narrative: Covid-19 Relief for Inter-Faith Filipino Children

description.narrative: In the Philippines, religious conflict and natural disasters have caused suffering for millions of Filipino children. This program provides care for children who are victims of the Covid-19 virus and other disasters. Inter-faith cooperation teaches students the value of teamwork and unity. We provide face masks, basic food, clean water, and hygiene. In response to the Covid19 crisis, we are currently providing PPE's, hand-washing supplies, and nutrition programs for more than 3,000 children.

title.narrative: Volmoed Staff COVID-19 Funds to Raise 60% Pay

description.narrative: Volmoed Retreat Centre and the staff have been severely impacted by the total lockdown in South Africa, due to the COVID-19 virus. Bookings have had to be cancelled for the foreseeable future, resulting in an end to income to pay the staff for the next months. The staff have been shifted to 60% of their salaries until bookings return, which may not be until the end of 2020. These funds would enable Volmoed to support the staff during the next six months and in future emergencies and crises.

organisation.narrative: The Volmoed Trust (for Healing And Reconciliation In South Africa)

Crecemos will provide nutritious and balanced meals to families, as well as hygiene and protection kits (detergent, soap and masks), will help pay for medicines and medical care for people infected between May and October.

The focus of its mission for the past 34 years is reconciliation, focused on racial reconciliation, and reconciliation within families or groups. Groups or individuals come for training programs, conferences on reconciliation, group learnings, wellness retreats, peace & to relax. Due to Covid-19, there are no visitors and no income.
